intro: Meibomia floridana, commonly known as the Florida meibomia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and pine flatwoods. Meibomia floridana is often found in areas with partial shade and is adapted to the humid climate of its native range.
